situation.title: Hospital visits
situation.meta_description: Visits of patients in the medical facilities of all medical service providers, offering inpatient care are prohibited with exceptions.

content.processed:
Hospital visits 

Visits of patients to all health care providers in inpatient health care facilities are prohibited. The only exceptions of visits are the following:

  • teenage/underage patients, 
  • patients with limited legal capacity,
  • hospice patients and other patients with terminal stages of an incurable disease.

The visitor must wear a respirator or other protective device without an exhalation valve with a filtration efficiency of at least 94% (class FFP2 / KN 95). For children from 3 to 15 years of age will be sufficient a surgical veil.

 

Third-person presence in childbirth

The presence of a third person in childbirth is allowed if the following conditions are met:

  • The third person is the parent of the child or a person living with the parent in the same household.
  • The birth will take place in a private room or box with its own bathroom.
  • Contact of a third person with other patients will be precluded.
  • The third person will undergo the temperature measuring before entering the room or box.
  • The third person has a body temperature of less than 37.0 ° C and at the same time has no symptoms of Covid-19.
  • A third person uses a surgical veil as minimum respiratory protection (fabric veil or scarves are therefore not enough).

Please check other rules and measures of particular health care providers.

Visit follow-up and long-term healthcare facility

Visits of patients in health care providers in health care facilities where long-term or follow-up inpatient care is provided are possible only if one of the following conditions are met:

  • Before the visit, undergo a POC test for the presence of SARS CoV-2 virus antigen directly at the facility you want to visit. The result has to be negative.

  • Undergo the test for the presence of SARS-CoV-2 virus by RT-PCR with a negative result, no later than 48 hours before the visit. Bring negative results with you as proof.

  • Prove that you had the covid-19 in the period not more than 90 days before the date of the visit.

The visitor must wear for the whole duration of the visit FFP2 (KN95) class respirator. An FFP2 respirator has to be without an exhalation valve. An exception is children under two years of age, children from two to fifteen years of age if they wear at least a chirurgical weil.
